hiveArticle.title: Worldly Wanders #7 - Goodbye Cape Town, South Africa
hiveArticle.body:
This really is a sad day!

After spending the last week and a bit in Cape Town it is time to pack up and go home...

Life in the Cape is so different to what I'm used to in the northern part of South Africa. It really feels like you're in a different country down here.

![IMG_6334-Edit.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmbCqqNKRCuxhfEYHrAWaTT2obRoSQUPBMUN78czJwmwgs/IMG_6334-Edit.jpg)

I usually have mixed feelings when a trip comes to an end - I'm sad that I have to go but then I'm actually quite excited to just get home and sleep in my own bed again...
Anyone else feel the same?

Nonetheless, Cape Town has been great! In fact, it was so great that I have already planned another trip to the Mother City for September - yeah!!

If you missed any of my previous posts for this trip, please check them out here:
[Worldly Wanders #6 - Two Oceans Aquarium, Cape Town, South Africa](https://steemit.com/travel/@cheeto.blue/worldly-wanders-6-two-oceans-aquarium-cape-town-south-africa)
[Worldly Wanders #5 - Kiteboarders at Scarborough, South Africa](https://steemit.com/travel/@cheeto.blue/worldly-wanders-5-kiteboarders-at-scarborough-south-africa)
[Worldly Wanders #4 - Chapman's Peak, South Africa](https://steemit.com/travel/@cheeto.blue/worldly-wanders-4-chapman-s-peak-south-africa)
[Worldly Wanders #3 - Warrior Toy Museum, Simon's Town, South Africa](https://steemit.com/travel/@cheeto.blue/worldly-wanders-3-warrior-toy-museum-simon-s-town-south-africa)
[Worldly Wanders #2 - Boulders Beach, South Africa](https://steemit.com/travel/@cheeto.blue/worldly-wanders-2-boulders-beach-south-africa)
[Worldly Wanders #1 - Kalk Bay, South Africa](https://steemit.com/travel/@cheeto.blue/worldy-wanders-1-kalk-bay-south-africa)

![IMG_6346-Pano-Edit.jpg](https://steemitimages.com/DQmQS2CZTeqGWZVjY7P7ZDQu6CVAYTmhTavzGtGMmQWiXih/IMG_6346-Pano-Edit.jpg)

---

Please upvote if you liked this post, follow if you want to see more, and let me know your thoughts in the comments.

Equipment used:
[Canon 6D](http://amzn.to/2sWCH11)
[Canon EF 24-105mm f/4 L IS USM ](http://amzn.to/2rUbFHv)
